item.description:
Welcome to everyone intrigued by neuro-linguistic programming (NLP). Here are the details of the January meeting of the Greater Boston NLP group.

First off, a reminder: we start the meeting at 6:30 for those new to NLP, those who want a review, and those who want to come early to socialize/network. At 7pm we will jump into the main event for the evening.

The main event(s) : Time Travel and Goal Setting

Happy New Year!

To kick off 2009, we're going to utilize a series of NLP techniques that have to do with "time travel" and goal-setting (note that we did the same process last January, with great results):
- We'll start with a guided Trans-Derivational search (review) of 2008, gathering up lessons learned in the past year.
- We'll use those learnings to generate Well-Formed Outcomes (can't-miss goals) for 2009.
- We'll then "Walk our Timelines" for 2009 to see more clearly how our well-formed outcomes come into reality in the coming year.
- Finally (if we have time), we'll use Circles of Excellence to give ourselves access to the internal resources that will be most useful to us in 2009.

This will be a great opportunity to learn (or review) a highly useful set of NLP techniques, while accomplishing some important planning for yourself for the coming year.

Everyone is welcome to this meetup, from beginners to experts. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions about the group in general or this meeting in particular. I will stay for a while after the meetup, if you want to work on specific issues you are having that were not addressed during the session.

Looking forward to seeing you there!
Adam

PS A reminder about the venue:
We meet on the first floor of Sturtevant Hall, 197 Herrick Road, which is near the library on the central quad of Andover Newton.
Andover Newton Theological School is conveniently located in Newton Center, with free parking. You can get directions here:
http://ants.edu/about...
Here is a map of the campus:
http://ants.edu/about...
Please note that this location is NOT handicapped accessible, as it entails climbing a short flight of stairs.

Adam Marx
NLP Master Practitioner
New Light NLP
Helping you to become the you that you want to be
Coaching, Counseling, and Training
adam@NewLightNLP.com
item.how_to_find_us: Walk straight ahead into the meeting room. I'll probably be the one talking.

group.name: The Greater Boston NLP and Hypnosis Meetup Group

item.name: The Greater Boston NLP January Meetup - Traveling your Vision for 2009
